messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The failing test `org.apache.commons.lang.time.FastDateFormatTest.testLang303()` belongs to the `FastDateFormat` class in the `org.apache.commons.lang.time` package. The test is related to serialization issues when serializing `FastDateFormat` instances. 

Next, I will check for the methods covered by failing tests in the `org.apache.commons.lang.time.FastDateFormat` class.

messages.name: get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class
messages.content: [".parsePattern()", ".getInstance(java.lang.String)", ".FastDateFormat(java.lang.String, java.util.TimeZone, java.util.Locale)", ".TwoDigitMonthField.TwoDigitMonthField()", ".TwoDigitMonthField.estimateLength()", ".PaddedNumberField.PaddedNumberField(int, int)", ".PaddedNumberField.estimateLength()", ".selectNumberRule(int, int)", ".TwoDigitNumberField.TwoDigitNumberField(int)", ".TwoDigitNumberField.estimateLength()", ".CharacterLiteral.CharacterLiteral(char)", ".CharacterLiteral.estimateLength()", ".getInstance(java.lang.String, java.util.TimeZone, java.util.Locale)", ".init()", ".parseToken(java.lang.String, int[])", ".hashCode()"]

The failing tests cover various methods in the `org.apache.commons.lang.time.FastDateFormat` class, including `.getInstance(java.lang.String)` which is called in the failing test `testLang303()`. 

Let me retrieve the code snippet for the `getInstance(java.lang.String)` method to understand its behavior.

messages.name: get_code_snippet
messages.content: "166 :     public static FastDateFormat getInstance(String pattern) {\n167 :         return getInstance(pattern, null, null);\n168 :     }"

The `getInstance(String pattern)` method in the `FastDateFormat` class simply delegates to another `getInstance` method with additional parameters. 

I will now retrieve the code snippet for the `SerializationUtils.serialize` method to understand its behavior.

messages.name: get_code_snippet
messages.content: {"error_message": "There are multiple matches to that query. Do you mean any of the following: {'get_code_snippet(org.apache.commons.lang.SerializationUtils.serialize(java.io.Serializable))', 'get_code_snippet(org.apache.commons.lang.SerializationUtils.serialize(java.io.Serializable, java.io.OutputStream))'}?"}

messages.name: get_code_snippet

messages.content:
The `SerializationUtils.serialize(Serializable obj)` method in the `SerializationUtils` class takes a `Serializable` object, serializes it, and returns the byte array representation of the object.

Next, I will retrieve the code snippet for the `serialize(Serializable, OutputStream)` method used in the failing test.

messages.name: get_code_snippet

messages.content:
The `SerializationUtils.serialize(Serializable obj, OutputStream outputStream)` method in the `SerializationUtils` class serializes a `Serializable` object and writes it to an `OutputStream`.

Based on the code snippets retrieved, the failing test `testLang303()` serializes and deserializes a `FastDateFormat` instance using the `SerializationUtils` class. The error message indicates a `java.io.NotSerializableException` for `org.apache.commons.lang.time.FastDateFormat$PaddedNumberField`, which suggests that the `FastDateFormat` class or its internal components are not serializable. 

To fix this issue, the serialization of `FastDateFormat` instances should be handled properly to avoid `NotSerializableException`. 

Here are the methods that could be potential locations to fix the issue:
```
org.apache.commons.lang.time.FastDateFormat.FastDateFormat(java.lang.String, java.util.TimeZone, java.util.Locale)
org.apache.commons.lang.SerializationUtils.serialize(java.io.Serializable)
org.apache.commons.lang.SerializationUtils.serialize(java.io.Serializable, java.io.OutputStream)
```

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).
